text: Cercosaura steyeri is a species of lizard in the family Gymnophthalmidae. The species is endemic to Argentina. ==Etymology== The specific name, steyeri, is in honor of Brazilian herpetologist Ligia Steyer Krause.Beolens, Bo; Watkins, Michael; Grayson, Michael (2011). The Eponym Dictionary of Reptiles. Baltimore: Johns Hopkins University Press. xiii + 296 pp. . (Cercosaura steyeri, p. 254). ==Geographic range== C. steyeri is found in Mercedes Department, Corrientes Province, Argentina. ==Habitat== The preferred habitat of C. steyeri is savanna, at altitudes of ==Reproduction== C. steyeri is oviparous. ==References== ==Further reading== *Avila LJ, Martinez LE, Morando M (2013). "Checklist of lizards and amphisbaenians of Argentina: an update". Zootaxa 3616 (3): 201–238. (in English, with an abstract in Spanish). *Tedesco ME (1998). "Una nueva especie de Pantodactylus (Squamata, Gymnophthalmidae) de la provincia de Corrientes, República Argentina". Facena 14: 53–62. (Pantodactylus steyeri, new species). (in Spanish). Category:Cercosaura Category:Reptiles of Argentina Category:Endemic fauna of Argentina Category:Reptiles described in 1998 Category:Taxa named by María Esther Tedesco
title: Cercosaura steyeri
